column54: AND DETERMINATIONS:  Post-Employment  Restrictions:    Former  City  employees  are  not  prohibited  by  the  City’s Governmental Ethics Ordinance from working for any particular new employer
column55: but the Ordinance does  restrict  the  activities  which  former  City  employees  may  perform  for  their  new  employers. Section 2-156-100(b) of the Ordinance provision governing post-employment restrictions states:  No  former  official  or  employee  shall
column56: for  a  period  of  one  year  after  the termination of the official’s or employee’s term of office or employment
column57: assist or represent any person in any business transaction involving the City or any of its agencies
column58: if the official or employee participated personally and substantially in the subject matter of the transaction during his term of office or employment; provided
column59: that  if  the  official  or  employee  exercised  contract  management authority with the respect to a contract this prohibition shall be permanent as to that contract.  Under  this  provision
column60: former  City  employees  are  subject  to  both  a  one-year  prohibition  and  a permanent prohibition after leaving City service.  For one year after leaving City employment
column61: former employees are prohibited from assisting or representing any person in a business transaction involving the City or any of its agencies if they participated personally and substantially in the subject matter of  that  transaction  during  their  City  employment.    The  one-year  prohibition  begins  the  day  an employee leaves City employment
column62: not on the date the employee stops performing a particular task. Former City employees are also permanently prohibited from assisting or representing any person in any  contract  if
column64: they  exercised  “contract  management  authority”  over  that contract.  We will analyze each prohibition in turn.  Case No. 98053.A December 16
column65: 1998 Page 4  One-year prohibition:  Section 2-156-100(b) of the Ethics Ordinance prohibits you
column68: from assisting or representing [the consulting firm]
column70: in a business transaction involving the City if you participated personally and substantially in the subject matter of that transaction during your City employment.  “Assisting”  and  “representing”  includes  helping  a  person  perform  a  contract.    As  a  consultant working for [the consulting firm]
column71: you are assisting [the consulting firm] perform its contract — a kind of business transaction — with the City.  The Ethics Ordinance defines “person” to include corporations
column73: firms and associations.  § 2-156-010(r).  You stated that [the consulting firm] is a corporation.  Therefore
column75: [the consulting firm] is a “person” whom you are assisting in a business transaction involving the City.  Subject matter of the transaction:  To determine how the one-year prohibition applies to you
column76: the Board must first ascertain the subject matter of the business transactions on which [the consulting firm] has asked you to work.  In some recent cases involving construction or development of real property
column77: the Board has analyzed subject matter as the application of a City program to particular sites.   For example
column79: the Board held that a former employee who coordinated the supervision of field construction for City development projects was prohibited for one year from assisting or representing any person in a business transaction involving the City if the subject matter of the transaction was the application of the particular City construction program to any site on which he had worked with that program as a City employee. Both [Department C] field supervisors and private contractors working as field supervisors who managed the [Alpha] projects reported to you. You approved the vouchers which allowed private contractors to be paid for their work on [Alpha] projects.  On these facts

Permanent prohibition:  Section 2-156-100(b) of the Ethics Ordinance permanently prohibits you from assisting or representing [the consulting firm]
column102: in performing its contract with the City if

Both [the consulting firm’s] contract with [Department C] and the contracts which [Department C] entered into to complete the eight [Alpha] projects on which you worked are at issue. column114: you do not assist or represent [the consulting firm] on any [Alpha] project you worked on as a City employee.  [Alpha] project site contracts: The individual [Alpha] projects with which you were involved in your City job do not require analysis under the permanent prohibition. CDPH의 준비 작업 소개    시카고 보건 위원회(Chicago Board of Health)는 콜레라에 대응하기 위해 1835년 설립된 이후 필요 시  공중보건 비상사태에 대응해 온 반면 시카고 보건부(Chicago Department of Public Health)는  1998년부터 영구 비상사태 준비 및 대응 능력을 구축해 왔습니다.    당국의 활동은 2001년 9월 11일 발생한 테러리스트 공격 이후에 크게 활성화되었고 최근에는 시카고 내  공중보건 비상사태에 그 어느 때보다도 효율적으로 대응할 수 있는 준비를 갖추고 있습니다.    당국은 긴급 관리 및 통신 사무소(Office of Emergency Management and Communications)
column3: 시카고  소방국(Chicago Fire Department) 및 시카고 소재 병원 등 기타 시 기관과의 긴밀한 협력을 통해  시카고시가 비상사태에 효율적으로 협력하고 대응할 수 있도록 하고 있습니다.    당국은 병원 및 기타 건강 진료 제공업체

column9: 언론 등 대도시 지역 전반의 기타 주요 조직과 관계를 구축하고 지속적으로  강화하고 있습니다.    지속적인 품질 향상을 목표로 당국은 실전연습 및 실제 위기 대응을 통해 주기적으로 비상 대응 운영을  평가하며 스트레스 테스트를 수행하고 있습니다.                   www.cityofchicago.org/health
